Back to Robert Schumann

Robert Schumann

Studien nach Capricen von Paganini, op. 3

1832

[IMSLP]

Total duration: 15'

  • 1. A minor
  • 2. E major
  • 3. C major
  • 4. B-flat major
  • 5. E-flat major
  • 6. G minor

The studies are arrangements of extracts from Nicolò Paganini’s twenty-four caprices for solo violin (op. 1); another six arrangements are the sechs Konzert-Etüden nach Capricen von Paganini (op. 10). Schumann also later wrote piano accompaniments to the original twenty-four caprices (Anh. O8).

Recommended editions

  • Gesamtausgabe (Schott) · III/1/1 · RSA 1016 [in preparation]
  • Henle · HN 920 · Sämtliche Klavierwerke / Band I · ed. Ernst Herttrich
  • Henle · HN 921 · Sämtliche Klavierwerke / Band I · ed. Ernst Herttrich
  • Henle · HN 614 · ed. Ernst Herttrich

1. A minor

This is an arrangement of the fifth caprice.

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 4.5

2. E major

This is an arrangement of the ninth caprice.

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 4

3. C major

This is an arrangement of part of the eleventh caprice.

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 3.5

4. B-flat major

This is an arrangement of the thirteenth caprice.

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 4

5. E-flat major

This is an arrangement of the nineteenth caprice.

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

6. G minor

This is an arrangement of the sixteenth caprice.

Duration: 1' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5
